moves.1. Nf3:
the Reti, maybe.
an opening with ot much anbition, in my opinion.
moves.1... d5 2. d4: well, white has changed the opening to some kind of queen's pawn.
moves.2... Nf6 3. Ne5:
strange...
in that way white plays with the same piece twice (instead of developing other pieces) with no specific plan to jestify his move.
it's better to play solid like 3. c4 or 3. g3 or something like that.
moves.4. Nxf7:
not clear.
why to sacrifice the piece. there are no one who's attacking with it...
moves.4... Kxf7:
when they give you, take.
when they beat you, run.
moves.5. dxc5 e5: white, with his last move, gave black also the center.
moves.7. Bd2: 7. c3 was a bit better (in those cases it's better than Bd2).
moves.7... axb4: of course. leaving white with double pawns on c file.
moves.8. Bxb4 Nc6 9. c3 b6: the weak link now is b4.
moves.10. cxb6 Nxb4 11. e3: nothing to do, white is lost...
